Review.Titre: They of course had the highest price…
Review.Contenu: They of course had the highest price for my Iphone 14 Pro and my wife's Iphone 14.  I sent them both phones separately in the original box.  I had my phone in a case for the entire year I had and also my wife's.  We also had screen protectors on and they were removed when I sent both in.  They were in excellent condition. Original offer was $567 - When they received, the offer went to $32 because of deep scratches on body of phone and screen?  They sent me pictures and the pictures showed a phone that was probably 5 years old or more?  When I complained, they upped the offer to $426.   Then when my wife's phone showed up, the original amount was $357 and they offered $239 because of Deep scratched on the screen???I told them to send back.  When I got them back, I examined them and both phones had zero damage or scratches on the bodies and mine had a minor 1/4 inch scratch that was not there when I sent in.  This company is definitely a bait and switch company that takes advantage of people by not giving them what they quoted on new phones.  Most of the positive reviews were on older phone.   Doing business with them is a valuable waste of time.

Poor experience. My phone went to them in perfect condition and was returned with two punctures and large scratch after I declined their revised offer. I would not have believed it if it had not happened to me. I would carefully photograph and document your property before sending.

Review.Titre: Kept my device and received nothing
Review.Contenu: Kept my device and received nothing. I would not recommend them. Somewhat deceptive. If your simply recycling the product, why bother sending to you all. I could have recycled myself for free.

Review.Titre: They made up that my phone had scratches to deduct $50 from what they originally told me
Review.Contenu: I sold them my iphone 13 pro which has been in a case since day 1. There's no noticeable scratches unless you really look for them and you'll see tiny soft scratches which is still impressive for a phone that's been used for hours for 2 years straight. They deducted $50 because it wasn't in flawless new condition which felt like a way to just get my phone mailed into and turn around and pocket $50 for themselves.

Review.Titre: Bait and switch, avoid at all costs.
Review.Contenu: Bait and switch, definitely suspicious, most likely scammy.Here are the facts. They quoted me a price for buying my phone ($622) which was much higher than the phone was selling for, used, on eBay ($560). Already this is "too good to be true" but I decided to give them a shot based on good reviews online.When they received the phone, they tell me something is hazy in the front facing camera (there has never been an issue I noticed using any of my cameras), and now are quoting me $172. Complete BS. I request the phone to be sent back to me, now worried they are scammy and may not even send the phone back. I said no. They say wait now we'll offer $258 to "save me the time" of shipping back. Scammy.I said no, give me my phone back. They come back with a $310. Now I'm really worried they're not going to send my phone back.I said no, they eventually send it back, and I proceed to trade it into Apple for $500+. Complete waste of me time dealing with this company, super scammy feeling.
Bait and switch company.  They’ll find a way to reduce your offer.  They even sent me pictures of a scratched phone that wasn’t mine.  Avoid.

Review.Titre: After my offer of $161.00 from Scam…
Review.Contenu: After my offer of $161.00 from Scam Back Boss I mailed my iPhone 10 in the original box with the power cord to them. I received an email from them saying it was worth $43.00. They said the screen was separating from the case. I said that prior to shipping my iPhone 10 to Scam Back Boss it was thoroughly inspected by the manager at the phone store. Then Scam Back Boss said we’ll pay you $65.00. I said no I want you to ship my iPhone 10 back to me. Today I received my iPhone in a box without the original box and they stole my power cord. Buyer Beware. I am going to give my phone to a member of my family.

Will never do business with this company again. The price they quote you is not what you will receive. They don't tell you they charge you their portion of a PayPal fee, something another vendor I used for my Galaxy Watch did not do. They took longer than their stated time to send payment and customer service was extremely poor and non-existent. I am terribly sorry, but I cannot recommend this company to anyone I care about.
Horrible experience, never using this service again. Payout was extremely long and price decrease for whatever reason when both devices were mint, bad taste in my mouth.

Total scam. Offered 625 for really good condition 14pro 256 unlocked. They get it and say it's a heavily scratched 14 plus and offered 225. I told them it was a mistake and provided serial number they than said ok it's a pro and offered 300 so told them it was an insult and then they kept offering smaller amounts and sent a pic of my screen with fingerprints acting like it was scratched. Finally offering 500. I declined and had it sent back and it was  close to a perfect phone! Don't fall for the big offers they are very dishonest

Review.Titre: Bait and switch! Good offer then say device is broke and offer half
Review.Contenu: Gave a very good initial offer for 3 iPhones. All phones were used but always in cases and no signs of visible wear when I sent them.  I sent the phones to them and they didn’t get back to me for over a week after I sent them. I had to reach out them them. They said 2 phones had cracks in the screen and one was in good condition but offer $100 less than initial offer. Non of them had scratches or cracked screens. I have requested they send the phones back. We will see what happens. I took pictures of the phones before I sent them. Hopefully they send them back and without broken screens.

Looking at the reviews from BuyBackBoss, I decided I would give them a try.  I've always sold my old i-phones through an internet company and made out well.  The phone was in fantastic shape and I was told I would get $237 for it.  Email came 2 weeks later offering me $144.  I've never had an experience like this before.  They eventually came up after discovering the phone was unlocked and worth more but never offered the original amount.  They admitted they were there to make me happy and that didn't happen.  I eventually got my phone returned in the mail....4 weeks of B.S.
Bait and switch, they offer a high amount and then take weeks to review your order before sending you a revised low ball offer.

Review.Titre: High offer to lure client, then wham!
Review.Contenu: High offer to lure client in then lowball offer with excuses. Multiple bartering options to not return product back to client, ultimately bringing price higher to client's asking. Felt the entire process was a scam and would definitely not recommend or use again.I couldn't reply to Brittanys reply so I edited mine to answer. That was a flat out lie on any financial obligation. Phone was completely paid for 6 months ago. The only thing wasbrhe screen had been changed by Apple. Because of that you stated it wasn't flawless, yet it was completely free from visual defects or scratches of any kind. Your company is a scam artist and sellers beware, they will rip you off. If my product wasn't up to par, why did you eventually raise your offer oeivecto avoid returning it after I refused twice????? Liars and scam artists to the fullest. Hopefully others will see this and run far away.

Review.Titre: The company is very slow to respond
Review.Contenu: The company is very slow to respond.  Poor customer service.  They offer payment by gift card as option.  However, do not describe the option much.  I reached out to them by email (only option).  They informed me I will have 1000+ card options.  Upon receiving the payment via Prizeout, i discover, i had only approx. 20 card options.  Again, not much support at Prizeout.  In addition, Prizeout dynamically changed the prices of the card while I was selecting it.  I would not do business with them again.

Bait and switch, I sent in an immaculate phone, for a quoted buyback price of $288. This was quckly reduced down to $78. Acording too them my battery would only charge to 78%. Their standard is 80%. Which would of qualified for the orginal quoted price. I flat out rejected this offer as well as two more low ball ones that followed.  I then offered to come down to $240 final offer. If they didn't accept I'd just like my phone back. They sent me my phone and I traded it in to Samsung for $315 on a new phone. Which is what I was going to do with the money anyways. It pays to shop around. Buyback Boss is betting on you taking what you they offer and not going through the hassle of waiting for the return and selling it someplace else. This business model counts on you being desperate for cash or too lazy to shop around someplace else. "Just take what the Boss is offering peasant. Your lucky to be getting that much."

This company is very misleading because on sellcell.com where they have their ads it says payment speed next day. But In fact it’s 10 business days. I think they need to fix that and they can’t say that’s not their website because if you are advertising on someone else’s website your information should be correct. I know you see your ads on their website. So I give this company a 1 star because people choose a website based on payment speed.  And even on your website it doesn’t even give a timeframe

They jerked me around for almost 3 weeks, the phone I sent them was perfectly fine in good shape and they told me they were going to pay me $257. They examine that phone for three weeks and all of a sudden at the last minute they said oh there’s a small chip on the phone. How do I know they didn’t put the chip in the phone or if there even was one,when I had it there was in great condition so they offered me $84 and I said you’re a bunch of crooks so they offered me 124 and I accepted, only reason I took it because I didn’t want to deal with them anymore,  I would never ever ever use them again,I have a history of selling my phones online(10) to various other dealers of used iPhones and I have never ever had a problem. This was a total catastrophe and very unprofessional people.

Review.Titre: Missing device and then low ball offer
Review.Contenu: I sent in my iPhone 15 Pro Max, which they quoted online as $757 for Good condition. My phone had spent its entire life in a case and the battery health was at 90%. I took pictures before sending it in and wrapped it up securely in the manufacturers box. A week after the phone had been delivered I reached out as I had not heard anything. They stated that it had arrived and that they would inspect the phone within 10 business days of delivery. 11 business days go by and I don't hear anything so I reach out again. They respond that they need my IMEI number because they can't find my phone. After providing, they said they found it and will have it inspected right away. Another 2 days go by and I don't hear anything. I reach out again and am told someone will reach out with my estimate. I then receive an email that my phone has heavy scratching on the screen and they are reducing the offer to $455 ($300 less than original quote). They provided no pictures of the scratching in their first email. I respond back with pictures of the phone clearly showing that no scratches were present the day the phone was sent out. I tell them to send me my phone back. Another 2 days goes by and someone from another company, GadgetGone, responds back and now offers $520. In this email they do provide pictures of the phone. They claim they did not scratch my phone purposely to reduce the payout. I request my phone back. I believe that both Buyback Boss and GadgetGone are quoting high payouts but as soon as you send it to them, they offer significantly lower payouts. Additionally, since phone value is highest right before or after a new iPhone has been released their slow response times and losing my device reduced its value. I am waiting for my phone to be shipped back to me so I can inspect it and consider what action to take next. Luckily I documented my phone's condition with a lot of pictures before sending it to them.

I sent in a ipad and over the app they offered $412, I had taken pictures and know the exact quality of my ipad. Sent it in in safe shipping packaging. They emailed me with a $200 offer. When I asked why they said there was deep scratches on the back, I asked for pictures because that was outright insane, knowing it has not a single scratch when I sent it. He sent pictures of a ipad with scratches on the back. They either are trying to scam people by sending pics of a different device or they are making damages so they get to pay less. I will never recommend this place to ANYBODY.

Review.Titre: Answered all the questions on the app…
Review.Contenu: Answered all the questions on the app truthfully was told I would get $136 for my phone. Once they received it, they said they didn’t like the life of the battery and offered me $30. When I said no then they upped their offer. Why didn’t I get an honest offer right from the beginning?

Complete Scam! Save you're time and find someplace else. I sent in a like new device and was told my device would be reviewed in 3-4 days after delivered. 8 Days after delivery I had to reach out first, and they claimed employee shortage. Sure, I can understand tough times. But then they get back to me and give me a quote less than 30% of my original quote claiming excessive and deep scratches. I said no send my phone back or reevaluate. Then they "reevaluate" and claim that I had told them the device was something other than it was, my order receipt shows I input the correct device. But they also attached photos of "my phone" Showing bad scratches, but they look nothing like the pictures I had taken right before I sent my package. They either took pictures of another phone, or they damaged the phone when they received it. I hold technology in high regard and can successfully say I have never damaged a phone in my life. I have no idea how they get so many good reviews that made me originally think I could trust the place. But they are a complete scam.

Review.Titre: I would steer clear of this company
Review.Contenu: I would steer clear of this company.  I sent in a phone that had no scratches and always had a screen saver on it.  I got a message that my phone was deeply scratched and the offer dropped by 60%.  I asked for it to be returned and now it is badly scratched.  Beware! Update:BuyBackTronics just paid $95.  BuyBackBoss had offered 85 and lowered to 35 after they scratched it!

Review.Titre: I sold my iPhone 8 to buybackboss.com
Review.Contenu: I sold my iPhone 8 to buybackboss.com, order no. 183286. I was offered $77. When I tried to contact them two weeks after I sold it to them and sent it to them, the email would not go through. I think it is a big scam and I am pissed off that they would not provide a phone number to contact them. They did finally get back to me by text or email and said that due to a battery issue, they were only going to pay me $17 with no proof of the strength of my battery vs. what it should have been band still did not provide a phone no. to contact them!
Bait & switch.  Total baits & switch offered $77 paid $50 when the condition of my phone was exactly as described for the $77 offer.  Rip-off, don’t trust these people.

This place is a Scam!!Sent them 2 Luke new samsumg s9+ phones and the website said in excellent condition would give me $210.00 for both phones. Don't get me wrong, I know I'm not getting rich off the phones but 210 is 210!Get and email saying that both phones where broke and both had "ghost" images burned into the screen!! They said they'd give me $44.00 for them, SCAMMMM!!NOTHING I CAN DO.I have to pay to get them returned and I guarantee they will break them just to prove a point.Just keep you old phone, maybe you might need a phone in an emergency. If you want to sell your phone DO NOT GO TO THIS COMPANY!! IT A SCAM!! GIVE THE CUSTOMER A FEW BUCKS, THEN SELL YOUR PHONE FOR HUNDREDS!!

I sent my iPhone to these rip-off artists. I took 10 pictures prior to sending it in as proof of what it looked like before I sent it. Well, they had offered $144, but when they sent me what they thought it was worth, they said $38. I told them to send me my phone back. They responded by telling me that you could pull the glass screen away from the phone as it was supposedly cracked there. They even sent me a picture of the damage on the phone. The phone had NO damage before I sent it to them. They then told me they could offer $58. I told them to return the phone to me AND if my phone is damaged, I will add more to this Review for their abhorrent behavior. BE AWARE! These people WILL RIP YOU OFF! NEVER USE THEM!! THERE ARE MORE REVIEWS LIKE MINE. 😡
They are so deceptive. I would stay away from them if you can. They offer you a price and take forever to pay and then offer you a ridiculously low amount.

Review.Titre: Sent in a like new IPhone XR
Review.Contenu: Sent in a like new IPhone XR. They claim there are deep scratches in the screen that were not there when I sent it in. Only giving me half of my quote.

Review.Titre: I will start with what I expected
Review.Contenu: I will start with what I expected, had just traded the same phone Samsung note 20 ultra 5g) in the same condition to T mobile for 800 (added a line to my account) took less than 10 minutes to clear data and unlock!  Saw their ad on sell your sell, advertised same or next day on payment....I had downgraded the phone to good (always in a case and screen protector) Sent phone in on Aug 8th the same day I received authorization to send it in and secure the "offer" . I had sent in the original box, charger and cord.   I received a couple of emails checking to see if everything was accomplished and ask if any questions. Everything seemed fine and very positive....expected the same experience trading the phone in....even followed mobile instructions on erasing the phone. First issue (after phone was sent) discovered (from reviews) they throw away everything but the phone on receipt.... It wasn't theirs to show away! They didn't buy it ....what is the term or word for taking someones possessions without compensation? I can think of a lot but stole comes to mind.... I had a pristine phone with box, instructions, charger and cord....reminds me of a Pink Panther movie , Peter Seller wrecks a piano and they say "this was a priceless Steinway .... he responds ...not anymore! " I then get an email saying they (buyback) will get around to it in a week or so (so much for same day) Also responded elsewhere they don't have room to store boxes Maybe buy a bigger van to work out of? They had NO RIGHT to throw away something they didn't own (that now I have to buy to sell the phone) thieves or incompetence ? I finally get a reply saying the phone was locked because of iCloud or google or Samsung .... The phone was not on any such plans and gave them the screen lock code (but have no idea why)  They offered me $0000 and ask if the should recycle it (a phone that T mobile gave $800 for on trade in)  Just got the phone back, bought the stolen parts, charged it up and works perfectly after initialization setup procedures ....I didn't need the screen passcode or my social security numbers the ask for ?????? What I did find is my phone is worth a lot less now than several weeks ago and buyback no long seems to give any value on my phone.  The only thing I can conclude is they decided to no longer buy this phone (Samsung note 20 5 g) and this was an easier way for them to not pay.... I don't believe they are at all honest or a reliable "company" and they owe me for stealing not to mention the inconvenience I Read their reply , in response they did ask for my ssn# at the same time they wanted my screen pin. The last 4 digits of an ssn# can be just as damaging and when they say they didn't ask its a lie. Two points , the fact that they destroy charger, box and cord should be on the same initial instruction page not after the device was sent according to instructions for shipment (device was already gone and after a check up email not much later) Also when I checked on sell your cell to find another buyer it stated buyback wouldn't purchase this phone (maybe correcting their original statement that they advertised ...Same Day...) and lastly the stinking phone was not locked when I sent it and when it was returned ....I charged it (again after having purchased what they stole ) it fired up without any screen passwords ...ssn # ...all my data was gone. So "locked " is a lie... This is not a company to do business with...if they had any integrity they would have apologized , acknowledged and offered to pay for what they stole instead of excuses .

Review.Titre: How is this company getting great…
Review.Contenu: How is this company getting great reviews?? I originally told I would get $496 for my iPhone 12 that apple had just refurbished with apple care. Phone was still in original box with screen still covered by apple, clean and honestly looked brand new. The told me it was in fair condition and only offered $240. Said there were deep scratches. Not sure how that is because apple had just replaced the glass. It’s a bait and switch. I asked for it back,

Review.Titre: I sent in an iphone6S in perfect condition
Review.Contenu: I sent in an iphone6S in perfect condition. I was offered $60 for the phone. When they received it they said it had a scratch on the screen, which it didn’t and still doesn’t. They offered $20 and I told them to send the phone back. It came back damaged so that I can no longer sell it elsewhere. The screen now has vertical lines going through it, which it didn’t have when I sent it to Buyback Boss. Don’t use them.

Review.Titre: I sent them a samsung glaxy note 20…
Review.Contenu: I sent them a samsung glaxy note 20 ultra in very good condition.Then they sent me some pictures.In the pictures, they made new scratches on the screen to lower the price of the phone.Then a phone expert with poor eyesight prepared a report that the phone had a heavy scratch.I wanted the phone back.The phone did not come with the original box and charger.These thief arizona lizards stole those too!These are Arizona lizards!They think they are very smart.A few little b.tch.s and a few little b.star.s turn all this stuff up!Definitely stay away from these Arizona lizards!

Review.Titre: DO NOT USE BUY BACK BOSS
Review.Contenu: I sent in a brand new note 20 ultra in its original box with all accessories, had only been opened in the tmobile store to confirm imei etc.   when did not get the quoted amount from buyback boss asked for phone to be returned.   I got ONLY the phone, the original box and accessories did not get returned.   THIS IS BULL, phone is worth next to nothing now.  THEY ARE A RIP OFF.   Guess not being able to leave a review on the site should have clued me in.

BuyBackBoss tried to swindle me!  I shipped my "mint" condition iPhone 8 to BuyBackBoss. They originally quoted me to buy it for $137.  When they received it, they "inspected" it and said it had earphone damage and would offer me only $55.  I refused and had it returned. I sent it to Apple's trade in partner Phobio.  They inspected it and found it all good condition. They paid me $110. Don't use BuyBackBoss.

I was offered 196.00 for my mint condition IPhone XR. After they received it they said it had large scratches on the screen and offered me much less. I cleaned it and packaged the phone myself in the original iPhone packaging. I have the original photos of my phone prior to sending it to them. There is no way that it got scratched when I mailed it. I have not received my phone back or a tracking number as requested. They do not respond to emails. This company is a scam. Do not use them!Updated 9/8/22- Just got the response months after my post stating that my phone was not in mint condition. 😂 I sold it elsewhere in mint condition. This company promises you a lot until the get your device and then offer much less. Complete scam…run.

Review.Titre: Seems like a scam to me
Review.Contenu: I sent an iPad with cracked screen but otherwise worked fine. The day I sent it I reset it to factory settings. When they got it they claimed it didn't work at all. Instead of $200 I got $30. They can now repair the screen and make more money. I still accepted the offer because I didn't want to deal with having them mail it back. Seems like a scam from my experience.

Review.Titre: This sight is a total ripoff
Review.Contenu: This sight is a total ripoff, they get your phones that have been in life proof cases since purchasing, and take them out and box up and send to them, they tell us the phones are not in great condition but they are fair to damaged condition, SO BEWARE, YOU WILL Not Receive The Money THEY PROMISED you

Review.Titre: Sent my samsung note 9  phone to them…
Review.Contenu: Sent my samsung note 9  phone to them after being quoted $280. My phone is in mint condition, always hard cased with screen protector.  No scratches,dents or cracks. Upon their inspection they claim i have a screen issue which is an absolute lie. Tried to pay me $48 instead of $280. Do not send them your phone you will regret it

Review.Titre: Minimal edge of case damage and fully…
Review.Contenu: Minimal edge of case damage and fully functional nearly new Microsoft Surface Duo (original box, paperwork and cord) and they offer $15?!  Save your time and don't use this service.

Review.Titre: Systematic bait and switch via manipulation
Review.Contenu: Wow I wish I would have done more research. Buybackboss has well documented cases of systematic “bait and switch!” They offer one price associated with a specific and well described condition and then offer a price associated with a condition not representative of the device they received. They are taking advantage of human “immediate gratification” nature to scam people into choosing them over a competitor. Their use of manipulation gives companies with honest marketing tactics a bad name.

I had my screen replaced on my 2 year old iPhone XS Max. It was in almost perfect condition. Sent my phone to BuyBack and they offered me $70. Got them to send it back, took it to Best Buy and got $400. Don’t send your phones here. I contacted customer service about this 2 weeks ago and no response. You can also trade in your phone with Apple for cash. Don’t waste your time and money with BuyBack.

Review.Titre: Provided a honest assessment of my…
Review.Contenu: Provided a honest assessment of my iPhone, it was damaged and I was quoted $65. Mailed it in and got hit with even more things to drive the price down more even though it met the damaged description. $20 offer from them when they just scrap the things. Go elsewhere, don’t buy into the high priced guarantee hype.

They offered me $400 for my iPhone 11 Pro then dropped it down to $70 upon receiving the phone because of one problem in the settings I also sent the phone with the original box, charger and headphones and when I denied the price the only sent back the phone not happy with the service

Review.Titre: Most phones will be considered damaged.
Review.Contenu: Beware the fine print.  Unless your phone battery is operating at above 80% they will consider it damaged despite its actual condition. An iPhone 8 in near perfect condition was originally offered $160 but only received $70. To replace the battery at Apple would be $49 so the offer should have been $110. An average phone degrades 1% per month so if it’s more than two years old it will be considered damaged.  You can check your batteries capacity in the settings section under battery of your phone.

Avoid this company.  They are a scam.I gave them an absolutely like new iphone and they paid less than what they promised.Their plan, get your phone and downgrade the price and hope to beat you down.I will never do business with them again.I am in contact with the Arizona Attorney General.YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!!

Gave me a quote of $70 for my iPhone XS Max that I bought new and owned for 2 years. It no longer worked, hence the $70 quote. They received it, but took forever to confirm. I had to initiate contact 3 times to get an update. They informed me that they would not be sending my any money for my phone. They said it was stolen (nope, I’d owned it ever since I bought it brand new) and offered to “recycle” it for me. I successfully sold it to another buy back company for $100. Won’t use these guys again.

I am very disappointed in the quotes provided. None of the 3 phones have any visible signs of damage. All phones worked perfectly fine with the exception of the decreased battery life, which is expected from a phone that is 4 years old. I feel like your company found things “wrong” with the phones in order to de-value the devices. I would have been better of trading them to Verizon or Apple

Review.Titre: I had sent a brand brew refurbished…
Review.Contenu: I had sent a brand brew refurbished apple i phone…re done by apple itself and was told the camera did not work … I do not believe iPhone/Apple would send me a defective product… So therefore $40 was taken off the price… Not very happy… Jeff

Paid me twice. I refunded them and they then opening a claim case against me on PayPal. This made my account almost $500 negative. They put money into my account to fix it but my account still sits at a negative balance. The process was super easy and they paid quick but after having a case open against me for 2 weeks now I will probably never do business with them again.

Review.Titre: Giving one star but should be zero
Review.Contenu: Giving one star but should be zero. Was quoted $638 trade in on my iPhone 12 Pro. When it was received the revised quote was half that as buybackboss claims extensive scratching that was barely visible in the pic they sent me. Definitely a bait and switch as they quote the most and revise the offer once they have your phone and assume you just want to finish the transaction. It’s been 5 days since they low balled me and they still have not sent payment. I have sold phones else where and recommend trying any other service to buy used electronics. They obviously take advantage of people and use sketchy practices ti offer the most and pay the least.

Wish I could give 0 stars.   Tried to buy a used phone - they said 11 available and took my money but low and behold ---  oops sorry we were wrong we don't have any in stock and will hold your money for up to 5 days (if I get it back).   Don't trust these people.   Update - they also tried to flag my review saying it wasn't them - once again trying to avoid responsibility!!!Yet another update: they tried a 2nd time to flag this review but trustpilot has now marked my review as verified - time to own up buyback boss!  They do NOT want to accept any responsibilty for their actions or let the truth be exposed...sad.

Website listed broken buttons for iPhone under damaged. Didn't mention that if it was the touch sensor that was damaged then it is considered broken and payout was half. Phone was in great condition otherwise. Felt like I was ripped off but didn't want to bother with having them send it back so took the crappy deal.

Review.Titre: Right after I sold my phone to Buyback…
Review.Contenu: Right after I sold my phone to Buyback Boss, I had login attempts on many of my accounts from Spotify to Facebook. I cleared the data off of my phone and cannot make a definite connection between this Buyback Boss and the login attempts but it was alarming and confusing. Be careful.

I have no idea why they have so many positive reviews unless they are paid. The online quote system is buggy and inconsistent, when you email customer service they ask questions you already answered in your original email, I had wanted to send in both an iPhone and and iPad on the same shipment. It would save me on finding two boxes and them on the shipping cost. Anyway, they failed to adequately answer my questions on the iPad, which caused delays (especially with my busy schedule) and the next month, they said they could only pay me $6 instead of $76! Wow, such a drop in just a few weeks? Not even worth it at $6. I had suspicions that this company is not ethical and I would not advise sending in a device to these guys.

Scam!!!! Sent my phone back and they say there’s still money owed on it when it’s long been paid off. I had the phone with Sprint and Sprint says there’s no balance due. They send me a screen shot from Ting.com, NOT Sprint, saying it’s not paid off. Sounds like a total scam to get the phone for nothing!!!

Review.Titre: Sent in my iPhone 6 per the quote of …
Review.Contenu: Sent in my iPhone 6 per the quote of $140.  I received an email today stating the frame was "slightly bent" which usually falls in their "Broken" category.  The new offer is $60.  This is after a store rep offered to take it in trade for account credit as it was in excellent condition.  I feel this may be a bait and switch or some damage occurred there.  This phone was kept in one of two rigid cases during the two years of my ownership, had no scratches or dings.  I emailed that I wanted it returned.  Very disappointed in what I thought was going to be a simple transaction.

Got a quote.   Then the amount went down every time I turned around.   Started at $260.  Ended up only getting $5 after I already paid for overnight shipping.   Lost money on this deal .  Got totally screwed

Changed the price on me. This is twice. I will find some one else.Update. They Changed there mine after this review or because of this review. And paid me the original amount. I still don’t see  using them again.

I am honestly very upset.  I sent in an iphone that was no longer working as the screen was black and would not turn on, so I was unable to swipe my phone clean. I even contacted the other company to ensure I was giving an accurate description of my Iphone 7 - 128GB. Their issue was the battery life - 78%. They responded after I did exactly as they asked and was denied based on their explanation of: "Unfortunately, their standards are different than ours, so since we do deduct for poor batteries (anything below 80% according to Apple standards) we are not able to match to their "Good" pricing."Why have a guarantee of price matching if you are going to change your policy in mid transaction? I checked their site for the conditions of the price match and could not find any "qualifiers" concerning who they will match.What a waste of time and aggravation. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!

When I shipped it in the (factory box for protection), I carefully inspected all surfaces including the screen to check for any defects.  There were NONE, It met their standards for the condition stated and quoted a price for, yet they claimed it was not in great condition after they inspected it. They were basically calling me a liar. I noticed on their site that they were were now quoting a lower price for the same phone, so I can only assume that they were trying to renege on the price quoted because the market went down. I held my ground and told them to either return it in the same condition I sent it in or pay me what I was quoted. If there was any damage it occurred once they received it. They paid me what I was quoted.

Review.Titre: Worst company I have ever dealt with
Review.Contenu: Worst company I have ever dealt with.  Unethical, unprofessional, crooks.  I have tried doing business several times with this company in the past and they are the biggest con artist/ripoffs on the face of the planet.  Do yourselves a favor and before doing business with them or mailing our device consider facebook marketplace, the eco atm at any local shopping mall, or even trading it into the retailer you are getting your new phone from.  I have sent them several devices in the past including two recently.  All of my devices are always in pristine condition the only problem is they state they will "price match" and I try to price match them with declutter and they always find something "wrong" (this time they stated my device wouldn't turn on) yeah okay good thing I took a picture of it on while I wrapped it up and took a picture of the serial number before I sent it .  Then they try to tell me my devices are broken and devalue them to near broken condition and try to pay me close to nothing $50.  Then they try too bait and switch I'm sure they are going to send me back a device I didn't originally send them, or swap out the internals like logic board or send me back a bricked device.  Extremely suspect, the car salesman of iPhone resellers.  This company is a joke.  They do not answer their phones, their email is just some face they hide behind.  Regardless of what resolution you try to offer this review isn't coming down.  I also will never send you another device or recommenced you again.  You have lost a customer permently and hopefully many more future ones once they read this review.

Review.Titre: Form Communication is the Norm--Incorrect and Sent When Office Closed
Review.Contenu: Ok transaction--somewhat better than trying to sell on Craigslist or eBay.  Continuous form communication, not relevant to the actual status of my sellback, was NOT appreciated.  I received multiple form email messages and a form text message.  One of the email messages stated that they did not receive my phones--even when USPS reported them retrieved from the post office.  Replies to those form messages, including use of actual email address instead of form letter reply addresses, went unanswered--they did not respond "immediately".  Form communication sent over the New Year's holiday, even when it was stated that the office would be closed for the Christmas / New Year's holidays.  A telephone call to the company did not receive a response.  No bounce messages received when I tried communicating via email.  These communication problems would not have been an issue except they used intercom-mail.com to send their form communication and did not pay attention to details.  Experience not good--will be much more careful in purchasing cell phones to avoid needing to sell them.Reply:  Note that OPEN communication is NOT maintained.  NO responses were received to my emailed messages--both to your form letter email addresses and your standard email addresses.  Including the form letter inquiry stating my phones were not received when, in fact, they were picked up at the post office earlier that day.  Urgency is not maintained as no responses were received.  I will not be sending any emails to you as time appears to be wasted in doing so.Reply 2:  ANY missed email message is bad--however, MULTIPLE "missed" email messages = unprofessional.  I am an IT pro and know how email systems work.

Review.Titre: Buyer beware — protect yourself before sending in
Review.Contenu: Make sure you take detailed pictures of your device, front and back, including in direct light and with the IMEI number showing. I sent my phone in using their provided packaging and they sent me back photos of a device with all kinds of scratches on the screen and offered me a much lower price than I was quoted. I negotiated and took a deal because I didn’t trust them to send me my phone back in any sort of condition to sell to someone else given the shenanigans that happened with my submission. I will not personally be using this company again. If you do, take as many steps as possible to protect yourself and document the condition of your phone before you send it in because I suspect I am not the only one they have tried a bait and switch on.

Significantly reduced the amount of money they gave me for phone based on their inspection. I do not agree with their assessment, but was not worth it to argue with them.I should have just sold the phone back to T-Mobile for more money than Buybackboss gave and a quicker turn around of getting the money.Their process was easy but be warned they will not give you the full amount of the original estimate and the turn around time is not fast.

I signed up on with Buyback Boss, put in the information for an iPhone 12 Pro Max, and iPhone 13 Pro Max and a third generation iPad Air. I received their offers and accepted them and began the process.  Before I sent my items in, I read a couple of reviews which stated that they sent in phones in excellent shape then were told that they had scratches when received. When I get a new phone, I have a new case and screen protector before I open the phone. I then open the new phone, inspect it, and put on the protection. I am over the top ridiculous when it comes to protecting my phones.  Just to protect myself I videoed my phones and myself wrapping them. I even wrote to them asking if they wanted the original boxes and charging cables. As I said, I am over the top.  They did not. So I removed the protective screens, removed the cases, cleaned the phones and then wrapped them in foam, and then in bubble wrap before sending them. I received an e-mail when they were received and the e-mail said that I would be hearing from them in 5-9 days. On the 9th day I received e-mails that stated that I returned my items after the allowed 14 day return policy, so I would be getting a reduced amount.  After I had to bother myself sending them all the paperwork showing that I did not return them late, they agreed and said that I would not be charged extra for a late return. The next day I received my changed offers based on the deep scratches on my phones.  As I stated earlier, no, my phones were in perfect shape. I have the video since they had done this to others and I needed to protect myself. After mulling over my altered offers and thinking about the fight that I would get, the offers were not lowered enough to waste my time arguing with someone who would run such a scam for a few bucks.  I did get my money the next day. Now I have received my new iPhone 15 Pro Max and have an iPhone 14 Pro Max to sell.  It is in perfect shape, but I will be looking for a more honest company to sell them to.

i included the case and everything was brand new. for them to tell me it has scratches that are "noticable" so instead of 90$ they gave me 50$ instead. I would go somewhere else to get a better quote but I wasn't going to mess with them shipping it back just to wait even longer. I don't think I'll be using them again.

Review.Titre: Could have gone worse, could have gone better
Review.Contenu: Gave them a like new iphone 13 pro that I barely used.  Glass screen protector and case installed at the store.  Then discovered when buyback got the phone that somehow the screen had been keyed.  Nearly 200 dollars value up in smoke.  And if they returned the phone it would be sans the case and glass as that's their policy to trash everything but the phone on receipt.  I even offered photos of the phone that I took before I shipped it.  No scratch there but they also had a photo of a gold 13 pro with a scratch.  Who you going to believe?  Doesn't matter.  They offered me 30 dollars to sweeten the pot.  Anything good about all of this?  The customer service is professional and the process in general is good even if it took two weeks to unbox the phone and process the return.  Technically 10 business days. At the slowest end of their stated business process. Definitely strip the phone down and take a lot of good photos otherwise an unboxer might decide to use his brand new house keys to peel screen protector off.  Doesn't do them any good, to be fair, but it also doesn't do you any good.   I guess the adage "never attribute to malice what can be just as easily attributed to ignorance" applies here.  Whelp.

Then I told them to send it back, they then increase the super low ball number and I still said no. They mailed me the phone back, luckily but did not send back all the original box, packaging, and charging cable I sent with the phone. They then told me, we throw all of that away, we do not send back.STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!!

On top of that an employee emailed me to try to lowball my original offer. I then provided all of my documentation of tracking and previous conversations with other staff members. They promptly paid my initial offer once I stood my ground and told them they could return my phone.

My phone was in excellent condition but during the process of shipping it must have gotten smashed up so I only got $30 it was a waste of money and time. $1,000 phone and I sold it for $30 SMH

Review.Titre: Kind of feel like they screwed me
Review.Contenu: Kind of feel like they screwed me. I was offered $100.00 for a 3 year old I-phone in like new condition. Once they got the phone it was only worth $60.00 as the battery was not up to standards. Wouldn't you assume that a 3 year old battery wouldn't be perfect. Review.Titre: If it seems too good to be true, prob is……

Sent my phones in and 5 days later learned it would be less than a third of what I was offered. CSR basically said that was that, offered to send back but of course they know they’ve got you and who is to say what my phones what have been like when I got back.  FYI buyer beware, if sounds  too good to be true probably is🙄
